DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study investigate corneal epithelial cell response associate lens wear result solution-induced corneal staining ( Phase1 ) determine cell appearance symptomatic asymptomatic contact lens wearer ( Phase 2 ) .
DOC.brief_title: Determination Cell Population Solution-Induced Corneal Staining ( SICS ) Symptomatic Versus Asymptomatic Lens Wearers
DOC.detailed_description: This study consist 2 phase . In Phase 1 , participant wear contact lenses pre-soaked overnight contact lens solution 2 hour 4 hour , separate day . A minimum 7 day separate wear period . Ocular surface cell collect wear period . In Phase 2 , participant wear habitual contact lenses daily wear basis 4 week habitual lens care . Ocular surface cell collect Day 1 Day 28 . Phase 2 include eligible participant complete Phase 1 new participant . A participant consider asymptomatic he/she typically wear contact lenses comfortably least 10 hours/day minimum 5 days/week , symptomatic he/she typically wear contact lens minimum 3 days/week experience ocular discomfort le 6 hour wear . Phase 1 participant eligible participate Phase 2 uninterested continue Phase 2 exit study .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria ( Phase 1 ) : Full legal capacity volunteer . Read sign inform consent form . Willing able follow instruction maintain appointment schedule . Current previous contact lens wearer competent insert remove contact lens . Uptodate spectacle . Other protocoldefined inclusion criterion may apply . Inclusion Criteria ( Phase 2 ) : Full legal capacity volunteer . Read sign inform consent form . Willing able follow instruction maintain appointment schedule . Uptodate spectacle . Wears single vision silicone hydrogel contact lenses , follow monthly replacement schedule . Has wear lens type minimum 2 month , exception 2 period lens wear participant also Phase 1 . Has use type clean solution minimum 2 month . Currently wear brand name contact lenses use brand name clean solution commercially available Canada ( private label ) . Other protocoldefined inclusion criterion may apply . Exclusion Criteria ( Phase 1 2 ) : Any ocular disease . Systemic condition may affect study outcome variable . Use systemic topical medication may affect ocular health . Known sensitivity diagnostic pharmaceutical use study . Presents significant amount corneal staining . Current use artificial tear and/or rewetting drop . Wears contact lens extend ( overnight ) continuous wear schedule . Other protocoldefined exclusion criterion may apply .
